annotation.TEXT: Also, get these four coins before you start hitting the multi-coin block.
Back on Earth (or whatever planet the Mushroom Kingdom is on), you can find another multi-coin block here.
Then, carefully roll the tire over to the right edge, and bounce off of it to find a bonus room.
There's a multi-coin block right here, which you might find while battling the Hammer Bros anyway.
Here we go!
And, with KONG spelled, we get another extra life, and... there's the exit! But, this probably wasn't the 3-1 you were expecting either, so...
Yeah, you need to be big to reach most of these coins.
This green guy is annoying. He likes to dig underground and then pop up somewhere else, and as soon as he starts his digging animation, he's immune to bombs, which makes him hard to hit.
And by spelling KONG, we get an Expresso token. Not bad.
You can get a power up from this ? block, but if you're trying to get all the coins, you may want to skip it. However, if you're small, you will need the power up to get many of the coins up ahead.
In this bonus room, touch the letters K, O, N, and G in that order to win a prize. Careful, hitting the wrong letter fails the bonus game.
This takes you to another bonus room! It's underwater, but there are no enemies here (except during the second trip through the game, in which I think a Blooper appears, so be careful of that).
Huh. I expected the star to fall into the gap I made there. Only rarely does it just hop straight out of its block like that.
Kicking bombs can be a handy means of attack, and just hitting an enemy with a kicked bomb (before it explodes) damages it.
In this bonus room, just fire every cannon immediately and you should get everything no problem! (Just keep rapidly tapping the button like crazy!)
Once again, fire the barrel cannon as soon as it's pointing the right way for the first time. However, those yellow bees at the end could sting you anyway, so you might want to be patient with them.
Ooh, a bomb pickup! Now I can drop two at once (this capacity can be increased up to a maximum of ten with enough pickups). Now, where's the exit...?

The "Red Bomb" that I just picked up allows my bombs' explosions to penetrate to the other side of destroyable objects, so I can hit an enemy on the other side of a flower by simply blasting right through the flower!
...I generally don't like doing that recklessly, because I'll likely destroy any power ups I find, such as the "Kick" item this enemy was holding.
Also, it's made more annoying due to the fact that enemies appearing from the exit get a large amount of invincibility time.
Okay, can I time this right?
Over here, take out the Necky, and then bounce off the tire and land on the light patch of ground to reveal the letter K.

Over here, you can land on the light patch of land to reveal a barrel, but... you don't need it, as you can also just knock open the bonus room's door by ramming it yourself during the same stomping combo!
Gotcha! Okay, I'm outta here! I hope everyone enjoyed watching me play these 3-1s! See ya!
Also, I can destroy multiple flowers in a row or column using the red bomb. Too bad I can only drop one bomb at a time right now. If only there were a way to fix that problem...
Yay! Diddy's back! And most of the time, I like controlling Diddy, since he's a little more agile. (There are times when Donkey's power comes in handy, though.)
Alright, to start off here, knock out the Mini-Necky with the barrel (or stomp it, or cartwheel into it, or whatever), then blast the Necky using the barrel cannon.
Also, note that in this particular game, hitting a Kremling reverses the rotation direction.
Awesome!
That green guy would be easier to take out with a kicked bomb, but he might be holding an item, so... let's try this!
Squish!
Then, use the resulting barrel to open up another bonus room in this L-shaped ledge.
There's the midpoint barrel. Don't worry about missing with this cannon. A misfire here won't kill you.
And here's proof that thrown barrels can block Mini-Necky's shots, so I don't know what the deal was with that other one earlier.

Now, to do that trick at the start that allows Mario to glide on one foot, hold A as the level begins to jump as soon as you appear, then fire a fireball anytime before you land (it doesn't have to be immediately upon the level starting).
And, over here, it's possible to do the classic kick the turtle against the stairs trick for extra lives, but... I'm running short on time, so I'm not going to bother.
Knock out the Necky up here, then from that perch, leap onto the light ground to the left.
Aha! He was holding something, and by quickly kicking the bomb out of the way after hitting him, the item was able to appear!
Argh! I hate it when that happens! For some reason, that Mini-Necky often gets off a shot that isn't blocked by the barrel. Watch out for that!

Also, if you're wondering why I'm placing only one bomb at a time, well... I simply used a password to go straight to this stage, so I'm kind of understocked. Interestingly, I know of two passwords that take you to this stage: 3452 and 4455. They both start you at 3-1.
Here, stomp the two Klaptraps, collect the bananas, wait for their invincibility to end, then repeat. Don't get bitten or you'll fail the bonus game!
Of course, this probably wasn't the 3-1 that you expected me to play, so let's try another 3-1...
Hello! Well, it seems I keep getting votes for 3-1, so... alright, let's go play 3-1!
This level is a little unusual in that the letter O is found after midpoint.
After dealing with that Hammer Bro, try to jump up to the floating pipe up here. If you need to, use the parakoopa to help you up.
There's the exit! Be careful not to blast the exit, or you'll have to deal with an additional enemy or two, and you can't exit the stage until every enemy is defeated!
Fire this barrel cannon as soon as you get into it.
After collecting these dozen coins, go through this pipe to return to the main part of the level.
Alright, let's enter this bonus room!
Carefully jump from cloud to cloud here, and then when you get to the end, just run right off the last cloud platform to get the last three coins.
Watch out for the Neckies' nuts here! With Donkey, you may be able to smack one of them with the DK barrel.
Also, this brick in the upper-right holds multiple coins, and you can get a high number of them if you reveal the hidden block here (which I did a moment ago) and stand on it.

There's a hidden 1-up here, but sometimes it doesn't appear. If you didn't warp straight to this world, you'll need to have collected enough coins in the previous world's third level for the 1-up to appear.
Yeah, I hit the flagpole with the timer's ones digit at 6, which gets me 6 fireworks!
Successfully grab ten banana bunches here and you'll win a 1-up balloon (in addition to the 55 bananas from the bunches themselves).
For most of these barrel cannons, you want to fire them as soon as they're pointing the right way for the first time. This should enable you to avoid every hazard.
Now, there are some piranhas down here, but there's an easy way to deal with them.
Oh, come on! How did I miss both of those goombas with both of those fireballs?
To exit this room, go down the leftmost pipe.

Alright, let's start bombing flowers! Now, due to the invincibility you start each stage with, you could just blow yourself up and then rapidly tap A while running around the place, destroying everything in your path for several seconds, but...
Just like that. However, I don't usually like to finish enemies off like that, because if they were holding an item, it won't appear if a bomb (or explosion) is currently overlapping that spot.
Hit the rightmost brick here to find a vine leading to a bonus area.
Okay, back here, throw this barrel to the right and...
Now, you can bounce off that springboard if you want, but it's totally unnecessary.
Star power activate! Now, you can clean out all of these coin blocks without worrying about getting nibbled on! (You could also just fry them, but since the star's here, you may as well use it!)
